description: Easy to change icons & names of applications!

Up until Ubuntu 21, this app was working flawlessly. 

After upgrading to Ubuntu 22, it stared acting up. 

Even after having saved details of an app in the menu, it continues to show a pop-out window that I cannot cancel. If I click the ave button again, it duplicates the app shortcut.

The only way that I was able to stop this process was to start the System Monitor and manually Kill the Menu Editor process.

Very frustrating...
Impossible to revert changes, some buttons are unresponsive.
When I use the Flatpak version of this app, I get duplicate icons that cannot be removed. When I use the distribution version (Fedora, in my case), it works fine.

I was trying to edit an app and then it created 3 duplicates of it and I can't even delete them.

Also to save edits i have to press the close button and then press save.

Not sure if it is better on other distros but definetly not on Arch.
I am not sure if it has to do with flatpak or not, I only used it in flatpak, but when trying to delete a menu entry, the app crashes. when adding a menu entry, it adds duplicates.
the program works, but in order for it to perform its function, you need to suffer. The problem is saving the changes, that is, if you change something and save it, then nothing will work.
